title: 108_hr4894
content: The "Disability Benefit Fairness Act of 2004" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The "Disability Benefit Fairness Act of 2004" eliminates the waiting period for disability benefits under the Social Security Act. The "Disability Benefit Fairness Act of 2004" eliminates the waiting period for disability benefits under the Social Security Act. The act includes amendments to section 223 of the Act, removing defined terms and making conforming amendments to ensure clarity and consistency in the definition of insured status. Section 223(c)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to clarify the application of subparagraph (B). Additionally, Section 202(e)(1)(F) is revised to address widow's insurance benefits based on disability. The Disability Benefit Fairness Act of 2004 eliminates the waiting period for disability benefits and ensures clarity in the definition of insured status. The Social Security Act is amended to revise widow's insurance benefits based on disability, eliminating defined terms and redesignating paragraphs for clarity. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability benefits and specify effective dates for the amendments. The amendment made by subsection (d) of this Act applies to disability determinations filed under title II of the Social Security Act on or after the 90th day following the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. ELIMINATION OF RECONSIDERATION IN THE REVIEW PROCESS GOVERNING DECISIONS ON BENEFIT ENTITLEMENT. An amendment to the Social Security Act eliminates the requirement for intervening reconsideration in the review process for initial decisions or determinations. This change applies to decisions issued after 1 year from the enactment of the Act.
